Key Match Events: Darius Garland scored a season-high 40 points.
Jarrett Allen had 18 points and 15 rebounds.
Evan Mobley finished with 21 points, 11 rebounds and six assists.
Scottie Barnes had 24 points, 10 rebounds and eight assists for Toronto.
Chris Boucher added 23 points and 12 rebounds off the bench.
Raptors: Boucher and rookie Jamal Shead combined to make 12 of their first 13 shots, including all eight 3-pointers.
Allen dove into the courtside seats to rebound Barnes’ missed turnaround that could have tied the score with 1:02 remaining.
Garland followed with a 3-pointer that extended the Cavaliers’ lead to 129-124.
Pre-Game Insights: Cavaliers guard Donovan Mitchell was given the night off after playing a team-high 35 minutes Wednesday in a 129-122 win over the Thunder.
Coach Kenny Atkinson said wrapping up a back-to-back set against the Raptors was 'a perfect trap game.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland’s players didn’t take the message to heart until the final quarter, when they outscored Toronto 34-23.
Center Allen and power forward Mobley made 15 of their 20 field goal attempts, continuing to bolster their case for being chosen to the Eastern Conference All-Star team.
